qas.question: What do monetary savings in crops from the use of pesticide amount to?
What amount is spent annualoy on pesticides?
How are consumers able to benefit from saved crops?

answers.text: vast quantities of produce available year-round

qas.question: In which area do pesticides creat jobs?
How is the health of the general publis affected by pesticides?

answers.text: control of insect-borne diseases and illnesses

qas.question: How much profit is generated by the agrichemical sector in the US each year?
How much money is spent each year to fight malaria?

plausible_answers.text: increase in crop yield and from being able to grow a variety of crops throughout the year

qas.question: In what ways do farmers benefit from the $10 billion spent on preventing malaria each year?
Farmers make $10 billion per year growing what type of produce?
What is the job market like if you want to be a farmer?

context: Every dollar ($1) that is spent on pesticides for crops yields four dollars ($4) in crops saved. This means based that, on the amount of money spent per year on pesticides, <a1_0><b6_0>$10 billion<b6_0/><a1_0/>, there is an additional <a0_0><b5_0>$40 billion<b5_0/><a0_0/> savings in crop that would be lost due to damage by insects and weeds. In general, farmers benefit from having an <b7_0>increase in crop yield and from being able to grow a variety of crops throughout the year<b7_0/>. Consumers of agricultural products also benefit from being able to afford the <a2_0>vast quantities of <b8_0>produce available year-round<b8_0/><a2_0/>. The general public also benefits from the use of pesticides for the <a4_0>control of insect-borne diseases and illnesses<a4_0/>, such as malaria. The use of pesticides creates a <b9_0>large job market<b9_0/> within the <a3_0>agrichemical sector<a3_0/>.
